question: Which statements about General Head Boundaries (GHB) are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! GHBs simulate two-way interaction with external systems like lakes or rivers. The head of a GHB is _not at the model boundary, rather it is removed from the model boundary by a conductance layer with the head being at some distance from the model_.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. GHBs are dynamic and allow both inflow and outflow depending on changing heads. The head of a GHB is _not at the model boundary, rather it is removed from the model boundary by a conductance layer with the head being at some distance from the model_.

question: What does the conductance $C_B$ represent in the GHB equation? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Well done! Conductance is a key parameter combining the geometry and properties of an external feature to control flow magnitude.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Conductance is not a head; and it has units of length squared over time as determined by (K Area)/L.

question: Which of the following leads to zero flow across a GHB? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! Flow does not occur when there is no head difference or conductance is zero.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Flow only occurs when there is a head difference and a non-zero conductance.

question: How does increasing $C_B$ affect the Q–h plot? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! Higher conductance means more flow for a given head difference.
error: ❌ Some of your choices are not correct. Conductance affects the slope of a Q–h plot, but not head or direction of flow.
